metadata.job_to_be_done: Plan a trip of 4 days for a group of 10 college friends.

subsection_analysis.refined_text: i Best Time to Visit : The best time to visit the South of France is during the spring april to june and fall september to october when the weather is pleasant and the tourist crowds are smaller i Transportation : The region is well-connected by an extensive network of trains buses and flights i Language : While French is the social language English is widely spoken in tourist areas

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Tips and Tricks.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: i clothing Light sweaters long-sleeve shirts t-shirts, and a light jacket or raincoat i footwear Comfortable walking shoes and sandals i Additional tips Spring can be unpredictable so be prepared for both sunny and rainy days

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Restaurants and Hotels.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: i Le compton du march (Nice): This bistro overs a variety of traditional French dishes at adorable prices The cozy atmosphere and friendly stay make it a great spot for a casual meal The cozy atmosphere and friendly stay make it a great spot for a casual meal

subsection_analysis.document: South of France - Things to Do.pdf
subsection_analysis.refined_text: i Marseille to Cassis : Explore the stunning limestone clips and hidden coves of calques National park i Cannes : Enjoy the sandy beaches and luxury beach clubs along the Boulevard de la Croisette. i Menton : Visit the serene beaches and beautiful gardens in this charming town near the Italian border

Here are some key types of food you can expect to find i seafood With its extensive coastline the South of France overs an abundance of fresh seafood i Proven√ßal cuisine This style of cooking emphasizes fresh vegetables herbs and olive oil i octan cuisine This cuisine features hearty dishes like cassoulet a slow-cooked casserole with beans sausage and duck and alight a cheesy mashed potato dish
